snippet: Mr. Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey, who prosecutors say traded political favors for vacations, campaign donations and flights, angrily denied wrongdoing and vowed to fight.
abstract: Sen Robert Menendez of New Jersey is indicted on federal bribery charges, first such charges against a sitting senator in a generation; is also charged with conspiracy; accusations lodged against Menendez, which include trading political favors for luxury gifts and campaign donations, are more extensive than what was publicly known.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nicholas Confessore from New York, Jason Grant from Newark, Eric Lipton from Washington and Frances Robles from Miami.

lead_paragraph: Mr. Menendez, Democrat of New Jersey, who prosecutors say traded political favors for vacations, campaign donations and flights, angrily denied wrongdoing and vowed to fight.

headline.main: Senator Robert Menendez Indicted on Corruption Charges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Charges Menendez Sold Political Favors
